etymology.description: Depicts wings or feathers, with strokes resembling an extended pair of wings
etymology.interpretation: The character 羽(yǔ) vividly illustrates an actual feather or pair of wings with its strokes, making it easily recognizable as related to birds or flight.

examples.chinese: 古人常用羽扇纳凉(古人常用羽扇納涼)，品味闲情雅致(品味閒情雅致)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén cháng yòng yǔshàn nà liáng, pǐnwèi xiánqíng yǎzhì.
examples.english: The ancients used feather fans to cool off, savoring a refined leisure.

examples.chinese: 一根飘落的羽轻轻落在肩头(一根飄落的羽輕輕落在肩頭)。
examples.pinyin: Yī gēn piāo luò de yǔ qīngqīng luò zài jiāntóu.
examples.english: A falling feather gently landed on the shoulder.
